segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s making me so anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children reaching for cookies, and I’m worried the stool is going to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the cookie jar that he doesn’t even see how unstable he is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn off the faucet before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting, and she doesn’t seem to care about the water either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone is going to notice the mess before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster, and no one is doing anything to stop it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman looks while everything is falling apart around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just spreading everywhere, and it’s making me so nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR
